description: Two convicts serving life sentences for separate high-profile murder cases are set to marry after developing a relationship in Jaipur's open-air prison. Both Priya Seth and Hanuman Prasad were granted 15-day parole to facilitate their wedding in Alwar. The parole decision is facing opposition from the victim's family in Seth's case.

title: Patrick Mahomes questioned Travis Kelce’s Taylor Swift romance before seeing it
description: Patrick Mahomes revealed he initially doubted Travis Kelce’s relationship with Taylor Swift until she appeared at Arrowhead Stadium. ESPN’s The Kingdom showed locker room disbelief, massive fan buzz, and how Swift’s presence reshaped game day energy. Teammates admitted the attention was overwhelming, yet the Chiefs stayed focused and won.

He believes Pakistan should challenge the cricket power structure by withdrawing, as their participation is crucial to the tournament's success. Latif questioned the ICC's dismissal of Bangladesh's relocation request, emphasizing the potential for sanctions but stressing the importance of taking a stand.

title: T20 WC row: Bangladesh cite India's 'privilege'; accuse ICC of double standards
description: Bangladesh Cricket Board accuses ICC of double standards after its request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India was rejected. The BCB cited safety concerns, contrasting the ICC's past flexibility in allowing India to play the 2025 Champions Trophy at a neutral venue.

title: Tambaram railway station to get new foot overbridge by March
description: The FOB is being built at a cost of ₹24 crore. It would have nine lifts and 10 escalators. It aims to enable quick access from both sides of the station

title: Killed for a cow: A mob lynching in Odisha and deepening mistrust between communities
description: On January 14, a man was beaten to death in Odisha’s Balasore district on suspicion of his involvement in what is now being called cattle trafficking by the police. Satyasundar Barik visits the family to piece together the events of that day, and examine how cattle trading is emerging as a flashpoint, deepening mistrust between majority and minority communities

title: Triple talaq-halala FIR puts focus on legal grey area
description: An FIR in UP details a woman's alleged gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after an instant triple talaq. The law banning triple talaq has been invoked, alongside provisions for rape and other offenses. This case highlights the legal grey area surrounding halala, a practice not recognized by Indian statutory law.

title: HC: Apart from refunds, how will you compensate flyers?
description: Delhi High Court has asked IndiGo to explain how it will compensate passengers affected by mass flight cancellations last December. The court noted that refunds are not the same as compensation. IndiGo is offering Rs 10,000 vouchers to some passengers. The court wants a detailed affidavit on compensation plans. Authorities have taken steps to prevent future disruptions.

title: Taylor Swift turns romance with Travis Kelce into new creative project: Report
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s romance has inspired billions around the world with the love, respect and commitment they have shown towards each other.While there have been reports that their high profile wedding might have been delayed, it seems Taylor Swift is already working on a new thing. To make it more interesting, her new project will be heavily inspired by her relationship with Travis Kelce.

title: Uttarakhand Congress MLA's son staged own attack; absconds after revelation

The leaders pledged to work together for UNSC reforms and peace in Gaza, with Lula also expected to attend the AI summit and a later BRICS summit.

Farmers are advised to postpone agricultural activities.

Party president Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi emphasized unity for the 2027 assembly elections, assuring no immediate leadership changes. Leaders must raise concerns internally, not through media, to present a united front for victory.

description: Sophie Devine's stellar all-round performance, featuring an unbeaten 50 and two wickets, powered Gujarat Giants to a dominant 45-run victory over UP Warriorz.  After posting 153/8, the Giants' disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Rajeshwari Gayakwad's three wickets, restricted UP to 108, ending a three-match losing streak and propelling Gujarat to second in the WPL standings.

The court's remarks came after the police failed to apprehend the minister's son following the rejection of his pre-arrest bail plea.

title: South Korea AI law: Startups fear regulatory risk; Government targets global AI lead

While the law mandates human oversight in high-impact areas and clear AI-generated content labeling, local startups express concerns about "regulatory risk" stifling innovation, despite a one-year grace period for compliance.

title: ‘Jason has…’: Travis Kelce’s playful announcement drops amid breakup rumors
description: Travis Kelce shared a surprising update about brother Jason Kelce on the Jan. 22 episode of “New Heights,” announcing the former Eagles center’s move to TikTok. The moment arrives as Travis weighs retirement after a 6-11 Chiefs season and faces ongoing Taylor Swift breakup rumors, with sources saying his career decision will come by early April.

title: Hockey India League: Needing to win by 7 goals for a miraculous top-four finish, Soorma Hockey Club fall agonisingly short with 6-1 victory vs SG Pipers
Ryan Coogler’s 'Sinners' makes history with 16 nominations at the 98th Academy Awards
description: In a groundbreaking achievement, Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners,' a vampire thriller featuring Michael B. Jordan, has dominated the 98th Academy Awards with an unprecedented 16 nominations. The film is making waves in major categories like Best Picture and Best Director, surpassing all previous records and marking a monumental milestone for the film industry and its visionary creators.

title: Pune Grand Tour | 'Never seen such a big crowd': How India and Indians embrace cycling
description: Massive crowds, curiosity and warmth defined the Pune Grand Tour as India embraced elite international cycling with rare fervour. From Saswad to Baramati, spectators lined roads normally meant for everyday life, leaving visiting teams stunned by the turnout and hospitality. Beyond results and jerseys, the inaugural race revealed India’s untapped appetite for global sporting spectacles.

Actor-producer files Rs 40 lakh cheating complaint against Palaash Muchhal in Sangli
description: A 34-year-old actor and producer has approached the police in Maharashtra’s Sangli district, alleging that he was cheated of Rs 40 lakh by composer and filmmaker Palaash Muchhal. Police confirmed on Thursday that no First Information Report (FIR) has been registered so far in the matter.

title: Bengaluru man injured during drinking session, friends kill him and dump body in well ‘to avoid consequences’
From saas-bahu to Sussex: Beckhams and Meghan Markle play the same script
description: This is why the ongoing Beckham family fallout and the long, slow implosion of Meghan Markle’s relationship with the British Royal Family belong in the same analytical universe. Not because one involves footballers and fashion designers while the other involves crowns and castles, but because both are stories about institutions mistaking themselves for families, families mistaking discipline for love, and younger generations refusing to accept that inheritance must come with silence as its price.

description: Pakistan's T20 series promo against Australia subtly reignites the handshake controversy with India. A video suggests a tourist forgot to shake hands, implying they learned this from India. This comes after Indian players previously avoided handshakes with Pakistani counterparts following terror attacks. The series is a build-up to the T20 World Cup.

Who has highest batting average in Test history? Short answer: It’s not Bradman
description: Born 105 years ago, Andy Ganteaume etched his name in cricket history with a solitary Test century for the West Indies. His debut 112 against England in 1948, in front of his home crowd, remains his only international innings. This remarkable feat propelled him to a Test batting average of 112, surpassing even Sir Don Bradman's legendary record.

Middle East $50 Billion Round: OpenAI seeks new funding amid crisis; Noble warns of chaos
description: OpenAI is reportedly seeking a massive $50 billion investment from Middle Eastern funds amidst growing concerns about its financial stability and competitive edge. Veteran investor George Noble warns the AI giant is "falling apart in real time," citing internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, and staggering losses.  Talent departures and a lawsuit from Elon Musk further compound these issues.

Explained: How BMC mayor is elected; quota, lottery, voting and the power play behind Mumbai’s top civic post
description: Mumbai's BMC mayoral race is a high-stakes political battle for control of Asia's richest civic body, extending beyond the ceremonial post. A fractured 2026 election mandate has forced uneasy allies BJP and Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena into intense negotiations, with real power residing in key committees.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands in the US; ‘Leader’ roles added
description: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: Golden Dome: Trump's Greenland U-turn & the ‘framework deal’ — 10 things to know
description: US President Trump claims a framework deal on Arctic sovereignty and tariffs with Nato chief Rutte, sparking confusion. Denmark and Greenland deny any Nato mandate for such talks. The proposed deal involves US military bases with limited sovereignty and a missile defence system, aiming to counter Russia and China's influence.

title: You’re 'not addicted' to screen: What is doomscrolling and why it feels impossible to stop?
description: Late-night scrolling through distressing news, known as doomscrolling, is a stress response, not a lack of discipline. Our brains, wired for survival, interpret constant negative information as a threat, leading to anxiety and sleep issues. Understanding this helps shift focus from self-blame to managing stress and practicing digital hygiene for peace

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she’s coping with Chiefs’ tough season
description: The Kansas City Chiefs’ billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team’s side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Quote of the day: Patrick Mahomes on never losing hope in adverse times
description: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: Quote of the day by Ralph Waldo Emerson: “The purpose of life is not to be happy...”
description: Nineteenth-century thinker Ralph Waldo Emerson challenged the notion that life's sole purpose is happiness. He argued that true fulfillment stems from being useful, honorable, and compassionate. Living a life of integrity and making a positive difference, however small, creates lasting meaning and satisfaction, far beyond fleeting joy. This perspective encourages a focus on contribution over acquisition.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‘Maybe he’s realised what everyone is worried about’
description: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.
